Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, NY  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER DeBlasio.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New  York, New York 10013.

Council Member DeBlasio moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Eric A. Goldstein to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his reappointment as a member of the Environmental Control Board, pursuant to Sections 31 and 1404 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Eric A. Goldstein, Environmental Control Board

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Department of Housing Preservation and Development - Submitting request from Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc., (Penn South) to seek approval from the Council, pursuant to Private Housing Finance Law Sections 114 and 125 for certain changes.
Items.MatterName: HPD Submitting request from Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Yassky:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20030175 PPK shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 72 Poplar Street, Brooklyn (C030175PPK)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Resolution calling upon the United States government to enact that portion of the United States Senate-adopted version of the President's economic stimulus package providing for $20 billion in state and local fiscal assistance, as well as to enact a national anti-recessionary revenue sharing program that would provide states and cities with direct federal assistance to mitigate the loss of revenues and increased service obligations during this current economic recession and other such recessions in the future.
Items.MatterName: U.S. Gov't to enact a national counter-cyclical revenue sharing program.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the United States government for taking threat information, critical infrastructure and population density into consideration when distributing homeland security and bioterrorism funding, and further calling upon the United States government to continue to account for such factors when distributing additional homeland security and bioterrorism funding and to distribute such funds directly to the City of New York and other high-risk localities across the nation.
Items.MatterName: Homeland Security Funding

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to reverse its decision to promulgate rules requiring the working poor to meet a higher standard of proof of eligibility for the Federal Earned Income Tax Credit than it requires for other tax benefits, and, if the IRS fails to reverse itself, calling upon Congress to act legislatively to stop the proposed action.
Items.MatterName: Federal Earned Income Tax Credit

Items.Title: General Order Calendar
Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution recognizing September 20, 2003 as International Beach Cleanup Day in New York City and urging all New Yorkers to volunteer to participate in the eighteenth annual nationwide beach cleaning event.
Items.MatterName: International Beach Cleanup Day in NYC, September 20, 2003

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to create and increase initiatives to promote swimming through recreation and education.
Items.MatterName: Create and increase initiatives to promote swimming through recreation and education.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to provide senior citizens with discounted rates for driver license renewals.
Items.MatterName: Provide senior citizens with discounted rates for driver license renewals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City Council to condemn the neglectful oversight by the General Services Administration of the African Burial Grounds Project and calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to conduct an oversight hearing to address such concerns and to act accordingly.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Condemn the neglectful oversight by the General Services Admin. of the African Burial Grounds Project.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Sampson, S.4347-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8433, "AN ACT to amend chapter 341 of the laws of 2002, relating to authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Richard Bothwell, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3868, Lots No. 20 and 22 on tax map for the Borough of Brooklyn also known as 891-895 Mother Gaston Boulevard in the borough of Brooklyn, in relation to identifying the correct former owner of such real property as Carol Ajoku".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Richard Bothwell, Brooklyn (S.4347-A, A.8433)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Sampson, S.4997, and Assembly Members Gordon, O'Donnell and Ortiz, et al, A.6879, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to the former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Housing Development Fund Corporation notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785, Lot Nos. 1 and 75 on the tax map for the borough of Brooklyn".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Elva McZeal, Brooklyn (S.4997, A.6879)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City to work to enter into a balanced settlement in Callahan v. Carey that acknowledges its obligation to provide safe shelter to homeless people and to discontinue its effort to gain judicial approval to eject homeless adults to city streets for a minimum of 30 days due to non-compliance with assessments, social service plans, housing search requirements, facility rules, or public assistance requirements.
Items.MatterName: Provide safe shelter to homeless people, Callahan v. Carey

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Congress of the United States to enact H.R. 947, the "School Capacity Relief Act," which would amend the federal Elementary and Secondary Schools Act of 1965 to allow school districts to prohibit the transfer of students from certain under performing schools into overcrowded schools, and which would provide federal funding to increase capacity at high-performance schools.
Items.MatterName: School Capacity Relief Act

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring training for record access officers or other appropriate staff.
Items.MatterName: Require training for record access officers or other appropriate staff.

Items.Title: Resolution expressing shock, sadness and dismay at the recent report that officers from British Army Intelligence helped Protestant guerillas kill Roman Catholics in Northern Ireland in the late 1980's, and expressing hope for an end to terrorism and our support and hope for a lasting peace there.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Expressing shock, sadness and dismay at the recent report that officers from British Army Intelligence helped Protestant guerillas kill Roman Catholics in Northern Ireland in the late 1980's.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the pre-qualification of bidders for public works contracts.
Items.MatterName: Pre-qualification of bidders for public works contracts.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Stavisky, Brown, Lachman, Onorato, Sampson and Smith, S.2126, and Assembly Members M. Cohen, Markey, Seddio, Cook and Pheffer, et al, A.772, "AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to civil liability of vehicle owners for maximum speed limit violations and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof".
Items.MatterName: Civil liability of vehicle owners for maximum speed limit violations (S.2126, A.772)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to support alcohol and drug addiction treatment and prevention programs with a dedicated fund that is maintained by the imposition of a one-cent tax on each bottle or can of beer sold in the State of New York.
Items.MatterName: Support alcohol and drug addiction treatment and prevention programs.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the former discriminatory policy against people with disabilities resulting from the MTA's denial of TransitChek privileges for Access-A-Ride users in early May of 2003, and supporting the subsequent reversal of said policy two weeks later.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disabilitity Services
Items.MatterName: Former discriminatory policy against people with disabilities resulting from the MTA's denial of TransitChek privileges for Access-A-Ride users.

Items.Title: Resolution opposing President Bush's FY 2004 budget proposal to eliminate the Section 8 Housing Voucher Choice program and replace it with block grants to the States and calling upon the New York State Congressional Delegation to oppose bills H.R. 1841 and S. 947, which would implement this proposal.
Items.MatterName: Opposing President Bush's FY 2004 budget proposal to eliminate the Section 8 Housing Voucher Choice program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the frequency of collection of designated recyclable materials and in relation to the collection of glass and yard waste.
Items.MatterName: Frequency of collection of designated recyclable materials and in relation to the collection of yard waste and Christmas trees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making it a misdemeanor to trespass upon the playing area of a professional sporting event and imposing a civil penalty for those who interfere with a professional sporting event.
Items.MatterName: Trespassing upon the playing area of a professional sporting event a misdemeanor.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring every individual, corporation or other entity with fifty or more employees in New York City to offer such employees the opportunity to use pre-tax earnings to purchase qualified transportation benefits in accordance with federal law.
Items.MatterName: NYC Employees the opportunity to use pre-tax earnings to purchase qualified transportation benefits in accordance with federal law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to amend the Penal Law to mandate that any person, while trespassing on the playing area of a professional sporting event who assaults an umpire, referee, player, coach, manager, or other sports official, be charged with a felony.
Items.MatterName: Any person trespassing on the playing area of a sporting event who assaults an umpire, referee, player, coach, manager, or other sports official, be charged with a felony.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Communications Commission not to weaken any current media ownership rules that protect people's access to diverse services and information; examine and better inform the general public regarding the consequences of weakening current media ownership rules, particularly the increased level of media consolidation and concentration that will likely occur; and to delay its upcoming June 2nd vote on proposed changes to current media ownership rules and to allow for extensive public review and additional comment before issuing a final rule.
Items.MatterName: Federal Communications Commission not to weaken any current media ownership rules that protect people's access to diverse services and information.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to amend the Penal Law so that trespass upon the playing area of a professional sporting event is considered an A misdemeanor.
Items.MatterName: Trespass upon the playing area of a professional sporting event is considered an A misdemeanor.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to creating a strict liability cause of action against weapons manufacturers.
Items.MatterName: Creating a strict liability cause of action against weapons manufacturers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the approval of materials and equipment used in building construction.
Items.MatterName: Approval of materials and equipment used in building construction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to limiting the amount that the mayor or member of the council may contribute or spend on ballot proposals submitted to voters by a charter revision commission.
Items.MatterName: Limit the amount that the mayor or member of the council may contribute or spend on ballot proposals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct an oversight hearing on the administration of the City's Food Stamp Program by the Human Resources Administration (HRA).
Items.MatterName: HRA's administration of the City's Food Stamp Program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon federal, state and local officials, and upon New York City agencies and institutions, to affirm and uphold civil rights and civil liberties.
Items.MatterName: Federal, state and local officials, and upon NYC agencies and institutions, to affirm and uphold civil rights and civil liberties.

Items.Title: Resolution mourning the death and celebrating the life, legacy and accomplishments of renowned leader, mentor, activist and human and civil rights advocate, Walter Sisulu.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Mourning the death of Walter Sisulu

Items.Title: Resolution to amend the contract between the City of New York and Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc. (1) to allow the Housing Company to impose a capital assessment of $960 per room payable in a period of 48 months beginning July 1, 2003 and (2) to modify the language with regards to succession and occupancy rights in the Housing Company.
Items.MatterName: Amend contract between NYC and Mutual Redevelopment Houses, Inc.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to establish the Second Avenue subway line construction project as a major priority and provide full funding for its completion through TEA-21 legislation.
Items.MatterName: 2nd Ave subway line construction project as a major priority and provide full funding for its completion through TEA-21 legislation.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill, introduced by Senators Maltese and Fuschillo, S.4551, "AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, in relation to permitting police personnel to accept other offices and to repeal section 1129 of such charter relating thereto".
Items.MatterName: Permitting police personnel to accept other offices (S.4551)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4717, and Committee on Rules, A.8371, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the industrial and commercial incentive program".
Items.MatterName: Industrial and commercial incentive program (S.4717, A.8371)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Velella, S.4961, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to refunding certain member contributions made pursuant to chapter 96 of the laws of 1995".
Items.MatterName: Refunding certain member contributions (S.4961)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Velella, S.4962, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions; and in relation to providing for employer pick up, pursuant to provisions of the internal revenue code, of certain additional member contributions required to be made by certain participants in the twenty-five year retirement programs".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed in police communications positions (S.4962)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.4691, and Committee on Rules, A.8378, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members (S.4691, A.8378)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.3300, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5981, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain lung disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments in certain cities".
Items.MatterName: Certain lung disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments (S.3300, A.5981)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.3376, and Assembly Members Abbate and Cohen, A.5923, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city sanitation members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto".
Items.MatterName: Permitting certain NYC sanitation members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions (S.3376, A.5923)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.3299, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5982, "AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments and providing for the repeal of such provisions of such law upon expiration thereof".
Items.MatterName: Certain disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments (S.3299, A.5982)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Robach, S.2980-A, and Assembly Members Abbate and Klein, A.6802-B, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the New York city employees' retirement system employed as water supply police; and to amend the retirement and social security law and the general municipal law, in relation to benefits for such members who are injured in the performance of their duties".
Items.MatterName: Establishment of twenty-five year retirement programs for members of the NYC employees' retirement system employed as water supply police (S.2980-A, A.6802-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Committee on Rules, A.8409, "AN ACT to allow Kevin P. McGuire to buy back certain time with the cultural institutions retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Allow Kevin P. McGuire to buy back certain time with the cultural institutions retirement system (A.8409)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.3966, and Assembly Members Abbate, Markey, Pheffer, Scarborough and Weisenberg, et al, A.4975, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing members of the police pension fund to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of New York police department cadet corps service".
Items.MatterName: Allowing members of the police pension fund to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of New York police department cadet corps service (S.3966, A.4975)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Marchi, S.4472, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island".
Items.MatterName: Designating the official flag of the borough of Staten Island (S.4472)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Committee on Rules, S.4791-A, and Committee on Rules, A.8069-A, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to discontinue the use of certain lands as park lands".
Items.MatterName: Discontinue the use of certain lands as park lands (S.4791-A, A.8069-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to videotaping the use of diversionary devices during a raid conducted by the New York City Police Department.
Items.MatterName: Videotaping the use of diversionary devices during a raid conducted by the NYPD.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold a hearing on the New York City Police Department's use of diversionary devices, including grenades, and the use of confidential informants.
Items.MatterName: NYPD's use of diversionary devices, including grenades, and the use of confidential informants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Manhattan District Attorney, the New York State Attorney General and the United States Department of Justice to launch a full scale independent investigation into the New York Police Department's use of diversionary devices, including whether discriminatory practices exist in their use, and to conduct a review of whether the procedure for "no-knock" search warrants is a civil rights violation.
Items.MatterName: Procedure for "no-knock" search warrants is a civil rights violation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to end the real property tax exemption granted to Madison Square Garden ("MSG" or the "Garden") so that the revenue raised from putting MSG back on the City's property tax rolls can be used to prevent the proposed closing of six City fire houses.
Items.MatterName: End the real property tax exemption granted to Madison Square Garden.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Education, in consultation with the New York City Police Department, to install video security cameras at all entrance and exit doors of each New York City public school.
Items.MatterName: DOE and NYPD to install video security cameras at all entrance and exit doors of each NYC public school.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation that ensures that victims of rape and sexual assault will not suffer the additional trauma of being  forced to pay for the cost of necessary forensic exams.
Items.MatterName: Ensures that victims of rape and sexual assault will not suffer the additional trauma of being  forced to pay for the cost of necessary forensic exams.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the sales tax.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the sales tax.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing personal income taxes.
Items.MatterName: Increasing personal income taxes.

Items.Title: A Local Law  to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to lobbyist registration fees and certain city clerk fees and to repeal section 27-4029 of the administrative code of the city of New York relating to exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits and inspections.
Items.MatterName: Lobbyist registration fees and certain city clerk fees.

Items.Title: A Local Law  to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing personal income  taxes and the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties.
Items.MatterName: Increasing personal income taxes and the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the late filing of financial disclosure reports.
Items.MatterName: Late filing of financial disclosure reports.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the public sale of taxicab licenses.
Items.MatterName: Public sale of taxicab licenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to setting interest rates for overpayments of the general corporation tax and banking corporation tax.
Items.MatterName: Interest rates for overpayments of the general corporation tax and banking corporation tax.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to public access to records.
Items.MatterName: Public access to records.

Items.Title:
By Council Members Sanders and Addabbo:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20030193 PPQ shall be subject to review by the Council.
